bugs.title: CVE-2018-10528 LibRaw: Stack-based buffer overflow in libraw_cxx.cpp:utf2char() allows for potential code execution [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2018-10528 LibRaw: Stack-based buffer overflow in libraw_cxx.cpp:utf2char() allows for potential code execution [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2018-10528 LibRaw: Stack-based buffer overflow in libraw_cxx.cpp:utf2char() allows for potential code execution

long_desc.thetext:
LibRaw through version 0.18.9 is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow in the libraw_cxx.cpp:utf2char() function. An attacker could exploit this to cause a crash or potentially execute arbitrary code.


Upstream Issue:

https://github.com/LibRaw/LibRaw/issues/144

Upstream Patch:

https://github.com/LibRaw/LibRaw/commit/895529fc2f2eb8bc633edd6b04b5b237eb4db564

Created LibRaw tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-6 [bug 1574321]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 1574322]


Created mingw-LibRaw tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1574319]
This was fixed in LibRaw 0.19.0-Beta4 and 0.18.10.

This bug is now closed. Further updates for individual products will be reflected on the CVE page(s):

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2018-10528

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of fedora-all.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an

when new packages are pushed to stable.

bugs.title: CVE-2018-10529 LibRaw: Out-of-bounds read in X3F property table list functionality in libraw_x3f.cpp and libraw_cxx.cpp [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2018-10529 LibRaw: Out-of-bounds read in X3F property table list functionality in libraw_x3f.cpp and libraw_cxx.cpp [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2018-10529 LibRaw: Out-of-bounds read in X3F property table list functionality in libraw_x3f.cpp and libraw_cxx.cpp

long_desc.thetext:
LibRaw through version 0.18.9 is vulnerable to an out-of-bounds read in the X3F property table list implementation in libraw_x3f.cpp and libraw_cxx.cpp. An attacker could exploit this to cause a crash via crafted file.


Upstream Issue:

https://github.com/LibRaw/LibRaw/issues/144

Upstream Patch:

https://github.com/LibRaw/LibRaw/commit/f0c505a3e5d47989a5f69be2d0d4f250af6b1a6c

Created LibRaw tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-6 [bug 1574329]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 1574326]


Created mingw-LibRaw tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1574327]
This was fixed in LibRaw 0.19 Beta-4.

This bug is now closed. Further updates for individual products will be reflected on the CVE page(s):

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2018-10529

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
